Automatically displays the Maximum Allowable Offer (M.A.O), right next to the estimated property value suggested by various real estate investment data platforms.

This Google Chrome extension effortlessly generates a PDF and Google Docs contract. It also computes a Maximum Allowable Offer (M.A.O.) with your Purchase Price, and integrates with Propstream.com, Propwire.com, BatchLeads.io, DealMachine.com, and MyReiPro.com.
Create Real Estate Contracts Instantly with this extension, ON-DEMAND, in a single click!

Forget wasting time copying and pasting! This extension is your secret weapon for automatically generating contracts. Imagine this: you're working through the real estate data portal, and a you've engaged a promising prospect. With a single click, our extension automatically populates and generates a (PDF, Google Docs and Google Sheets) real estate Purchase and Sale Agreement (from a template tailored to your business), with key details like seller's name, address, county, APN#, signature, and will even populate a purchase price (MAO). Stop the tedious data entry and increase productivity with our contract generation Chrome Extension. Now you can focus on what matters most - closing the deal!

Generates a fully populated, signed and deliverable PDF, Google Docs and Google Sheets file, based on your specifications.

Based on a Google Docs template that you pre-define, the extension computes a Purchase Price (Maximum Allowable Offer, M.A.O.), and pre-fills the contract details (from Propstream.com, Propwire.com, BatchLeads.io, DealMachine.com, MyReiPro.com) with Property Address, County, Parcel Identifier, Purchase Price, Earnest Money Deposit, Balance Payable to Seller at Closing, Closing Date and Buyer's Signature, all of which you can override before you generate the contract.

More about the Maximum Allowable Offer (MAO) or Purchase Price.

Automatically computes and displays the MAO right next to the estimated property value suggested on various real estate data platforms.

Simple Formula:

Example: For a property valued at $100,000, the extension computes:
$100,000 x 0.7 = $70,000 - $10,000 (fee) = $60,000 MAO.
Remember, this figure is before accounting for any repairs or improvement costs, which should also be deducted.
